SPN101.name: Elementary Spanish I
SPN101.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SPN101.description: Introduction to the practice of using and understanding Spanish to develop listening, speaking, reading, and writing skills. Pronunciation, grammar, vocabulary, and cultural topics.

SPN102.name: Elementary Spanish II
SPN102.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SPN102.description: Further practice in using and understanding Spanish to develop listening, speaking, reading, and writing skills. Pronunciation, grammar, vocabulary, and cultural topics.
SPN102.prerequisite: (SPN 101) or designated score on Spanish Placement test

SPN150.name: Review of Elementary Spanish
SPN150.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
SPN150.description: Review of elementary-level Spanish for students who have some previous study of Spanish and who need to strengthen communication skills and knowledge of Spanish language and culture.

SPN201.name: Second Year Spanish I
SPN201.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SPN201.description: Intermediate-level review and development of listening, speaking, reading, and writing skills. Topics in the cultures of the Spanish-speaking world.
SPN201.prerequisite: (SPN 102 or SPN 150) or designated score on Spanish Placement test

SPN202.name: Second-Year Spanish II
SPN202.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SPN202.description: Further review and development of listening, speaking, reading, and writing skills. Topics in the cultures of the Spanish-speaking world.
SPN202.prerequisite: (SPN 201) or designated score on Spanish Placement test

SPN250.name: Review of Intermediate Spanish
SPN250.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
SPN250.description: Intermediate-level Spanish. Development of listening, speaking, reading, and writing skills. Topics in the cultures of the Spanish-speaking world. Communication skills and cross-cultural understanding.
SPN250.prerequisite: (SPN 150 or SPN 102) or designated score on Spanish Placement test

SPN290.name: Independent Study
SPN290.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
SPN290.description: Special projects at the intermediate level arranged by an individual student and supervised by a faculty member in areas supplementing, but not replacing, regular course offerings.

SPN310.name: Basic Spanish Grammar
SPN310.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
SPN310.description: Instruction and practice in the basic structural patterns of Spanish.
SPN310.prerequisite: (SPN 202 or SPN 250) or Designated score on Spanish Placement test

SPN320.name: Cultural Readings and Composition (W)
SPN320.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
SPN320.description: Readings from texts that discuss or embody Hispanic culture, and writing based on those readings.
SPN320.prerequisite: (SPN 310) and completion of Tier I writing requirement

SPN330.name: Phonetics and Pronunciation
SPN330.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
SPN330.description: Phonetic description of the sound system of Spanish, developed linguistically and applied to the improvement of pronunciation and spoken Spanish.
SPN330.prerequisite: (SPN 202 or SPN 250) or designated score on Spanish Placement test

SPN342.name: Media and Conversation
SPN342.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
SPN342.description: Discussion in Spanish via journalistic and entertainment media and exposure.

SPN350.name: Introduction to Reading Hispanic Literature (W)
SPN350.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
SPN350.description: Close reading of poetry, drama, and prose.
SPN350.prerequisite: (SPN 320) and completion of Tier I writing requirement

SPN412.name: Topics in Hispanic Culture
SPN412.description: Analysis of diverse forms of cultural expression in the Spanish-speaking world.

SPN420.name: Spain and its Literature
SPN420.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
SPN420.description: Survey of literature written in Spain from the Middle Ages to the present.

SPN432.name: Latin America and its Literature
SPN432.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
SPN432.description: Survey of literature written in Spanish-speaking Latin America from the Colonial Period to the present.

SPN440.name: The Structure of Spanish
SPN440.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
SPN440.description: Overview of linguistic approaches to understanding the Spanish language.
SPN440.prerequisite: SPN 330 and (LIN 200 or LIN 401 or ENG 302)

SPN452.name: Topics in Spanish Language I
SPN452.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
SPN452.description: Improvement of language skills through applied practice.

SPN472.name: Topics in the Literatures of the Americas
SPN472.description: Thematic topics in the literature of the Spanish-speaking Americas.

SPN482.name: Topics in Spanish Linguistics
SPN482.description: Advanced study of the structure and usage of Spanish.

SPN490.name: Independent Study
SPN490.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
SPN490.description: Special project at the advanced level arranged by an individual student and supervised by a faculty member in an area supplementing, but not replacing, regular course offerings.

SPN491.name: Special Topics in Spanish
SPN491.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SPN491.description: Special topics supplementing regular course offerings, proposed by faculty on a group study basis.

SPN492.name: Senior Writing Project
SPN492.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SPN492.description: Research and preparation of a paper on an interdisciplinary subject that synthesizes at least three areas of a major's undergraduate education. Students work under the supervision of a faculty member.
SPN492.restrictions: Open to seniors in the Spanish major.

SPN800.name: Reading Spanish
SPN800.description: Intensive study of Spanish for students needing a reading knowledge of the language. Focus on reading comprehension of Spanish and translation into English.
SPN800.restrictions: Not open to freshmen and not open to sophomores or approval of department.

SPN801.name: Spanish Syntax
SPN801.description: Study of the formal properties of Spanish syntax within a generative framework.

SPN803.name: Language Variation and Change in Spanish
SPN803.description: Language variation and change in the Spanish-speaking world. Influence of social and linguistic factors.
SPN803.restrictions: A student may earn a maximum of 0 credits 3 credits may be earned.

SPN804.name: Spanish as a Second Language: Linguistic and Psycholinguistic Perspectives
SPN804.description: Major issues in the acquisition and processing of Spanish as a second language.

SPN805.name: Evolution of the Spanish Language
SPN805.description: Phonology, morphology and syntax of Spanish from its origins to the present.

SPN806.name: Topics in Hispanic Linguistics
SPN806.description: Issues in Spanish language in relation to current linguistic inquiry. Topics vary.

SPN810.name: Studies in Medieval Spanish Literature
SPN810.description: Works, genres, and writers of the Spanish Middle Ages (12th-15th c.)

SPN815.name: Literature of Early Modern Spain
SPN815.description: Poetry, drama, and prose of 16th and 17th century Spain. Topics vary.

SPN825.name: Literature from the Illustration to Realism
SPN825.description: Literature from post-Baroque Spain to the Generation of 1898. Topics vary.

SPN830.name: Spanish Literature of the 20th-Century
SPN830.description: Authors, generations, and tendencies that shape the directions of Spanish literature in the 20th-Century. Topics vary.

SPN835.name: Colonial Latin American Literature
SPN835.description: Major authors and movements of the Colonial period. Topics vary.

SPN836.name: 19th-Century Latin American Literature
SPN836.description: Major authors and movements of 19th-Century Latin America. Topics vary.

SPN840.name: 20th-Century Latin American Literature
SPN840.description: Poetry, drama, prose, fiction, and essay of Latin America. Topics vary.

SPN874.name: Seminar in Hispanic Literary Genres
SPN874.description: Hispanic literary genres, including prose, poetry, theater, and essays. Topics vary.

SPN875.name: Seminar in Popular Culture in the Hispanic World

SPN876.name: Seminar in Gender Studies in the Hispanic World
SPN876.description: Gender studies including feminism and masculine identities.

SPN890.name: Independent Study
SPN890.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SPN890.description: Special projects, directed reading, and research arranged by an individual graduate student and a faculty member in areas supplementing regular course offerings.

SPN891.name: Special Topics in Spanish
SPN891.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SPN891.description: Special topics supplementing regular course offerings proposed by faculty on a group study basis.

SPN893.name: Interdisciplinary Seminar
SPN893.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SPN893.description: Examination of a theme, topic, or genre from several different national and disciplinary perspectives in the appropriate cultural and socio-historical context. Significant texts and important critical analysis selected from Great Britain, Spain, France, Germany, the Americas, and others.

SPN899.name: Master’s Thesis Research
SPN899.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
SPN899.description: Directed research leading to a master’s thesis, used in partial fulfillment of Plan A master’s degree requirements.

SPN999.name: Doctoral Dissertation Research
SPN999.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
